title: Uncle Tom's Cabin
summary: Uncle Tom's Cabin; or, Life Among the Lowly.[1][2] is an anti-slavery novel by American author Harriet Beecher Stowe. Published in two volumes in 1852, the novel had a profound effect on attitudes toward African Americans and slavery in the U.S., and is said to have "helped lay the groundwork for the [American] Civil War."[3]
